newsitem.title: USA: Novell licenses linguistic to Microsoft.
newsitem.headline: Novell licenses linguistic to Microsoft.

text.p: Novell Inc on Wednesday said it has entered into an agreement with Microsoft Corp to incorporate Novell linguistic technologies into future Microsoft software products.
Financial details of the alliance were not disclosed, but Novell said it was a "multimillion-dollar" agreement.

The technologies covered by the licensing agreement include the Novell Collexion Grammar Checker, a flexible writing tool that lets users spell-check and correct grammar in documents of multiple languages.
Also covered is Novell's Collexion Morphology, a linguistic tool that breaks words down into root forms and facilitates grammar checking and advanced searching.

The agreement gives Microsoft the option to incorporate the Novell Grammar Checker into any future Microsoft product for the French, Dutch, German and Spanish languages. The Morphology agreement includes French, Dutch, German, and Spanish, as well as English.
